channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump and Fed chairman clash over renovation site cost. And, Gaza peace talks stalled
item.description: Trump and Fed Chairman Jerome Powell clashed over the cost of renovations to the Federal Reserve headquarters. And, ceasefire talks between Israel and...

item.title: People like extroverted robots — but they relate to the neurotic ones
item.description: Neurotic personalities are a staple of science fiction. Researchers who study how people react to robot personalities have recently found that neuroti...

item.title: Who or what is Trump's "beautiful baby?" Find out in the quiz
item.description: Plus, what are Tesla and Coca-Cola up to? And RIP Ozzy Osbourne and Hulk Hogan.

item.title: Fearing coverage could change, some parents rush to vaccinate their kids
item.description: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is changing how federal agencies handle vaccine recommendations. Some parents are hurrying to get kids their sh...

item.title: Trump voters wanted lower medical bills. But for millions, bills are about to go up
item.description: Moves by the Trump administration to pare back Medicaid, rescind medical debt rules and loosen vaccine requirements threaten to increase medical bills...

item.title: At least 7 children killed by school roof collapse amid monsoons in India
item.description: Police in India say 7 children died and at least 20 others were injured when an elementary school roof caved in after days of monsoon rains.

item.title: 'All the people are hungry': Voices from Gaza on desperate lack of food
item.description: All week across the BBC we've been hearing from people in Gaza about their lives as food supplies are restricted leading to malnourishment and starvat...

item.title: Iran meets European diplomats for renewed nuclear talks
item.description: The talks are the first since Israel and the US attacked Tehran's nuclear facilities in June.

item.title: New movies to catch this summer
item.description: "Superman" and "The Fantastic Four: First Steps" hit theaters this summer. Brent Lang, executive editor of Variety, joins CBS News with his picks.

item.title: U.S. birth rate is dropping, CDC reports
item.description: The birth rate in the U.S. is dropping, hitting an all-time low in 2024, according to new Centers for Disease Control and Prevention data. Dr. Joanne ...

item.title: Florida Gov. DeSantis says deportation flights from ‘Alligator Alcatraz’ have begun
Suspect at large after deadly shooting at University of New Mexico
item.description: The University of New Mexico campus has been shut down and students have been told to shelter in place after an early-morning shooting.

item.title: Former Congolese president on trial for treason
item.description: Joseph Kabila denies backing the M23 rebels, who have seized large parts of the mineral-rich east.

item.title: A man is stopped climbing the US-Mexico border wall. Under new Trump rules, US troops sound the alarm
Thailand warns clashes with Cambodia could 'move towards war'
item.description: Intense fighting at the disputed border has killed at least 16 people and displaced tens of thousands.

item.title: 9-year-old dies after incident at Hersheypark's water park, CEO says
item.description: A 9-year-old child has died after an incident at The Boardwalk water park at Hersheypark in Hershey, Pennsylvania, on Thursday.

item.title: Maxwell interview about Epstein 'very productive', lawyer says
item.description: The questioning by a US official, which will resume on Friday, comes amid a public clamour for the release of Epstein files.

item.title: Trump’s onetime friendship with Jeffrey Epstein is well-known — and also documented in records
item.description: The revelation that Attorney General Pam Bondi told President Donald Trump that his name was in the Jeffrey Epstein files has focused fresh attention ...
